abstract: Federal government announces it will choose new health insurance plan for anyone who does not select their own after their insurer drops out of Affordable Care Act marketplace; critics worry consumers may be rattled by new policy, which follows series of setbacks to Obama administration's landmark healthcare program.

headline.print_headline: HealthCare.gov Offers Warning for Undecided Consumers: We’ll Pick for You
headline.main: Can’t Find a Plan on HealthCare.gov? One May Be Picked for You.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Under a new policy to make sure people maintain insurance coverage in 2017, the government may automatically enroll them....
lead_paragraph: Under a new policy to make sure people maintain insurance coverage in 2017, the government may automatically enroll them.
